meanings.definition: To make or become bigger or more important.
meanings.sent1: She kept bigging up her achievements to impress her friends.
meanings.sent2: The company is bigging its presence in the market with new products.
meanings.sent3: He was bigging about how fast he could run, but then tripped and fell.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was bigging the room with warmth and joy.
meanings.sent5: The sun was bigging in the sky, casting a golden glow over everything.

meanings.sent1: He was always bigging about his expensive car.
meanings.sent2: Stop bigging so much about your accomplishments.
meanings.sent3: She was bigging about her cooking skills, but then burnt the dinner.
meanings.sent4: His bigging was like a loud trumpet in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The peacock was bigging proudly, showing off its colorful feathers.

meanings.definition: The act of making something bigger or more important.
meanings.sent1: The bigging of the project led to its successful completion.
meanings.sent2: His constant bigging of his role made others appreciate his efforts.
meanings.sent3: The bigging of the cake with extra frosting made it irresistible.
meanings.sent4: Her bigging of the story added excitement to the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The bigging of the mountain with snow made it a breathtaking sight.
